message: I've heard they always question tons of stuff and usually seem ambivalent, but I was wondering if there's anyone that knows first hand what it's like.
Don't know if you've seen this, but since it's from YC, it's pretty first hand: "How to Prepare for the Interview" - http://ycombinator.com/howtoprepare.html
Yeah I had been reading up on those articles. I guess I was looking for more of a less formal account of how things go
There is also this, which is pretty decent: http://ginzametrics.com/y-combinator-looks-for-outliers.html (scroll down to the Flexibility part)
My one piece of advice is practice 3 sentences.
I am building ...(one sentence).  Existing solutions suck because...(one sentence).  Our solution is better...(concrete reason).
For the concrete reason, better, faster, prettier isn't good enough.

A few things to keep in mind.  pg and company probably don't remember why they put you in the "call for interview" stack.  Their prep time for the interview will include skimming your application real quick when you sit down in front of them and probably lead off with a question they wrote down in their notes.
For me, the interview was chaos.  It was 10 minutes where 7 people ask questions at the same time and you try to answer them all as best you can.  Don't stress, it is what it is.
Good luck and have fun.  Enjoy the opportunity.  It's just geeks talking about toys.
here is a great post about YC and a few links to resources that are helpful with the application process: http://keepitfresh.frid.ge/post/3915901768/a-fresh-ycombinator-point-of-view-and-helpful

should also definitely join the YC Q&A Fridge: www.frid.ge/ycqa. there are YC founders as well as some of the YC team on there who are more than happy to help answer questions about any part of the process
It's a lot of fun. Don't stress. Don't over prepare. Have a Demo. Be yourself. It will be over before you know it
